channel.title: Image Conversion on Tech Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Image Conversion on Tech Notebook

item.title: Creating a Favicon for a Website
item.description:
Introduction link

A favicon is the small icon you see at the top of your browser, next to the URL. If you have a 16x16 size image, you can use the following method to convert it to the right format.

Converting an Image link

 convert -colors 256 -resize 16x16 face.jpg face.ppm && ppmtowinicon -output favicon.ico face.ppm

item.title: Converting a VMware Disk Image for Qemu or Xen
item.description:
Introduction link

I’ve switched to the new Ubuntu, great! Except for one thing: VMware doesn’t work yet, you have to wait for a patch, etc… but I don’t have time to wait!

VMware is nice and pretty, but it’s becoming annoying. So I decided to use KVM and QTqemu for the graphical interface. And here I am, ready to convert my VMware images.

Conversion link

For conversion, we’ll first use VMware for preparation and then qemu for the actual conversion:
